channel.title: Changes to the banning system [IMPORTANT]
channel.description:
There have been some significant changes to how we handle banning, this may be integrated into the forum in the future, but we don't have that sort of time to play with at the moment. Instead of (Like before) adding a name to the forum membergroup, you now have to ban a player ingame and post on this topic once you've banned them and for howlong + why (Like before). The difference is this time that the bans are automatically removed once the time the moderator specifies runs out, now onto command usage:
advbans.ban - /ban [time in minutes] [reason...] - ban player (if player is offline, plugin will use ip history) (example: /ban kyku 15 Spam) * advbans.unban - /unban - unban player (example: /unban kyku) * advbans.banip - /banip [time in minutes] [reason...] - ban player on ip AND NAME (using ip history) (example: /banip 127.0.0.1 60 Spam) * advbans.unbanip - /unbanip - unbanip player (example: /unbanip 127.0.0.1) * advbans.kick - /kick [reason] - kick player (example: /kick kyku spam)
It is a [b][u]requirement[/u][/b] that you post the information like in the old topic. Please, try to stick to one post per moderator and follow an easy to understand logging structure, so for example: User: Test Time: 4days reason: griefing date: 7/7/7 Finally, a few helpful minute notes to make life easier: 60 minutes -> 1 hour 1440 minutes -> 1 day 10080 minutes -> 1 week 43829 minutes -> 1 month If you're looking for a time that isn't stated there, simply use googles function or another one. User: meepJ Time: 5days reason: griefing date: 24/12/12

item.title: Changes to the banning system [IMPORTANT]
item.dc:creator: @omgilikepie omgilikepie
item.description:
@omgilikepie wrote:

User: flyingxbooger
Time: 5 Days
Reason: Multiple Griefs
Date: 10/25/12

Correct me if I’m wrong, but hasn’t flyingxbooger griefed and been banned multiple times?

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to the banning system [IMPORTANT]
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

User: supasal34
Time: 2 months
Reason: Grief
Date: 3/10/2012

(I tested the new ban system, i can’t be sure if its worked so let me know if it hasn’t)

User: MeepJ
Time: 1 week
Reason: Grief, generally being a nuisance for the sake of it which is far from appreciated when others are trying to work
Date: 1/7/2013

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to the banning system [IMPORTANT]
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

There have been some significant changes to how we handle banning, this may be integrated into the forum in the future, but we don’t have that sort of time to play with at the moment. Instead of (Like before) adding a name to the forum membergroup, you now have to ban a player ingame and post on this topic once you’ve banned them and for howlong + why (Like before).

The difference is this time that the bans are automatically removed once the time the moderator specifies runs out, now onto command usage:

advbans.ban - /ban [time in minutes] [reason...] - ban player (if player is offline, plugin will use ip history) (example: /ban kyku 15 Spam) * advbans.unban - /unban - unban player (example: /unban kyku) * advbans.banip - /banip [time in minutes] [reason...] - ban player on ip AND NAME (using ip history) (example: /banip 127.0.0.1 60 Spam) * advbans.unbanip - /unbanip - unbanip player (example: /unbanip 127.0.0.1) * advbans.kick - /kick [reason] - kick player (example: /kick kyku spam)

It is a requirement that you post the information like in the old topic. Please, try to stick to one post per moderator and follow an easy to understand logging structure, so for example:

User: Test Time: 4days reason: griefing date: 7/7/7

Finally, a few helpful minute notes to make life easier:

60 minutes -> 1 hour
1440 minutes -> 1 day
10080 minutes -> 1 week
43829 minutes -> 1 month

If you’re looking for a time that isn’t stated there, simply use googles function or another one.

User: meepJ Time: 5days reason: griefing date: 24/12/12

Read full topic
